meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sticky or adhesive.
meanings.sent1: The gluinesses of the tape made it perfect for sticking things together.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the gluinesses of the honey as it dripped from the spoon.
meanings.sent3: The gluinesses of the slime made it fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a gluinesses that stayed with me long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The gluinesses of the glue was so strong that it held the broken pieces together.

meanings.definition: The ability to stick or adhere to surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The stickers had a strong gluinesses that kept them on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The spider's web showed incredible gluinesses as it caught insects.
meanings.sent3: The gluinesses of the tape was so good that it stuck to everything.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty had a gluinesses that never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The gluinesses of the magnet pulled the metal objects towards it.

meanings.definition: The stickiness or tackiness of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The gluinesses of the syrup made the pancakes delicious.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the gluinesses of the paint as I touched the wet canvas.
meanings.sent3: The gluinesses of the candy made it hard to remove from my fingers.
meanings.sent4: The gluinesses of the situation made it hard to escape.
meanings.sent5: The gluinesses of the sap made it difficult to remove from my shoes.
